caption: I visited this bar/restaurant with a group of friends on a Saturday night. Was very happy to be able to get a table for 8 without a reservation. The beer selection is great with many of their own brews on tap. Food wasn’t anything to brag about but it was decent. The building is an awesome piece of Buffalo history. The prices were fair and service was great. I would recommend this restaurant.
Endless mimosas will always get 5 stars from me.
Great for Brunch
A menu making a mockery of the Pandemic is shameful.  Enough said.
Beers were pretty bad.. Building was neat but left after 1 beer and a couple samples. They were watching the Bachelor on the TV

Great grub and brew. Very friendly staff. Brew master gave us some facinating history of the building and great conversation. We can't wait to come back to Buffalo to check the other associated restaurants....

Food was delicious! Service was so so slow. We waited 40 minutes just to get a beer. And then had to wait again for our appetizer which came out wrong. Would highly recommend if the service was better, because the food was great!
Terrible. Steak overcooked. Small. No sides. Not even listed. They didn't even make my Manhattan right. Never go back.
Just awful! Good service but the food was horrendous. Burgers were dry with stale buns. The entire table hated their meals.

Made a reservation here for their Thanksgiving buffet from out of town based on reviews, and so glad we did. We had an amazing time. The location was lovely and spacious. The buffet was very nice and had a good selection of food and was served hot. All of the food tasted good as well. The carver chefs were very polite and friendly. A decent selection of beers but not enough choices to include a stout beer. Flight offering was a good way to go. The back of the location had a dessert spread located near a cozy fireplace and adjacent to a game room with billiards and pinball and darts. Super chill environment with a wonderful staff. Highly recommended! Thanks you for a lovely Thanksgiving dinner!

I have been here a few times for lunch or happy hour, and generally the service and food is pretty good. I have had several issues with servers/bartenders forgetting part of my order, but I'm not one who is afraid to ask for something, and they have never given me issue on this. Just a forewarning for others who may be more quiet or shy. I really enjoy the atmosphere, and it's right down the road from my office so it is very convenient, and I will definitely be back!
Nice atmosphere, good beer
Good beers and food. I like the music too
Good food,  good beer, would definitely recommend a visit.
Pretty average. Not too bad,  nothing spectacular.
Great food and fun atmosphere. Flat bread pizzas are awesome and so is their drink selection :)

Been here twice. The first time was around when they opened and I got food poisoning. The second was recently with a group of co-workers and both the service and food were very bad.  Despite our office being next door we haven't been back since and don't plan on it.
You need to come here! Engaging poytine and the "Don't call me Teddy" Baltic porter is good! Really cool architecture and building history.

This place is great.   The bar area is rich with history.  The beers are good.  Their IPA will satisfy and HOP HEAD looking for that style.  The food menu is not huge, but that’s a great thing.  The perfected what they have.   I loved the French Onion Soup.   It’s a great place to visit.

Had a nice quiet lunch with my daughter. Food was delicious our waitress was friendly and looked very happy in her job. Prices were reasonable much lower than you think an Angus burger with fries and all the trimmings cost 11.50 that and the atmosphere you can't beat it.
What a great venue.Check this place out .Very comfortable .great service
Good beer and beautiful location inside. Sat by the fireplace, so relaxing...wish we lived closer, this would be our hang out place!!
Great Bar. Went in on our back from Niagra Falls. Had a flight of 4 beers. Delicious house beers. Stout, Porter, Gosé Cuervo... very delicious.
Food was average. Not a big fan of the beer.  Ambience and service were excellent.
Excellent service! Just left the Warnke benefit and I was pleased with the appearance and the food!
Cool atmosphere for a brewery, kinda looks like a church!

I really loved this place. The atmosphere seemed like the place was original to the building, massive venue with lots of hidden treasures. Their beer was quite good. Had a baltic porter that was impressive and a lighter beer with a hint of sour called Gose Querva. That was quite good. Chicken wings and pot roast poutine were also delicious. Would definitely stop again next time I'm in Buffalo.

I would love to share how the food and service was, but unfortunately we were sat at a table and then forgotten about for a full 20 minutes so.... We left.  No, it wasnt busy that day either (and I have a restaurant and serving background.)

Not a really good experience . The waitress is barely there whereas the place is empty. When I was done with my pizza she brought the bill ... I never ask for it ... maybe I want to eat more ?? And I had to ask the desert menu to the hostess as my waitress was never around . But nobody ask me if I was ready to order desert... as a result of that , you don’t get more money from because you staff is not doing the job well ! I could have spent extra dollars in deserts. And no tips as well
It was a fun time watching the Syracuse FB game n the food was delicious!!  Also kid friendly!!!
Lively atmosphere, friendly staff, great service and a great downtown location near other activities.
Fun bar and venue.  Great hotel too.
Great beers like the Trainwreck and the best damn chicken nachos ever!

Staying at Beautiful Lafayette.. unfortunately this place is Attached was a beautiful sunny warm Afternoon, yesterday 🙏wanted to try Lackawanna Lager and lunch.  I I’m Sat at bar ignored by 3 dim wit servers chatting away other end of bar
Good stuff

Good enough craft beer for 3.50 at happy hour  in definitely the coolest restoration I've ever seen. So sorry I didn't see it until we were almost leaving  but near the bus station and a much nicer spot to wait.  Honestly. Should be busiest place in town.  wood! Dead animal heads and oldy timey phone booths
Great beer selection, food and service
Beautiful old hotel with historic fixtures.
Beers were good, cool space, very limited vegetarian options

Ordered from off skip the dishes. I paid extra for fries with my sandwich and didn't receive any. Also ordered the mozzarella wedges, they were supposed to come with marinara sauce and that was missing too. Food wasn't cheap and half of it was missing, won't be reordering or recommending.
Food was just okay.  Beer was pretty good but I got like a thimble sized glass worth of it ordering a Belgian Trippel.
The staff was great, just wasn’t a huge fan of any of the beers. But as far as the venue goes, this is a great place.

Our waiter was Adam and he was fantastic. He gave us all kinds of information about local areas to visit.  We ordered the garlic Parmesan wings and they were delicious....but you have to order them Adams way.   They baked the Parmesan after frying, making them very tasty and crispy.  The bar has a quant old but refreshed feel to it. Will go back
Fantastic Easter with my daughter and husband.

Cool deco architecture but lobby and common areas and restaurant are a  bit tired and need a good cleaning.  Rooms are nice and cool modern furnishings. Wish the lighting was brighter, rough to put makeup on or do work at the desk
Food was good, and well prepared. Excellent service, and good local beer selection. Love the old Lafayette Taproom vibe...
Was good, they need to take down the Christmas decorations, saint Patrick's day is almost here.
Clean up the sidewalk on Ellicott where your  dumpsters are leaking dumpster juice.  **Edit. This was written when owned by Pan American.
Good food,good service, and amazing atmosphere.

This is a tough one since the rest of the hotel and event planning at the Lafayette is incredible. The staff is incredibly undertrained and underwhelmed when it comes to service. If you're in the business of selling alcohol, and we have to hunt you down to get more alcohol: huge problem. Food took and incredibly long time to come out, and when it did, it had been sitting out and/under a heat lamp. Half of it was cold, the other half rubbery. Our waitress smelled like cigarettes, and as someone that's worked in food industry for years, she was probably out back smoking and not giving much thought to whether her 1 TABLE wanted more booze. This is why I gave 2 stars and not 1: I think this is a severe management problem. My brother is getting married here. Everything else at the Lafayette IS WONDERFUL. But this restaurant is a blight on the Lafayette. Get it together. Yesterday. This place should be a gem, it could be turned around so easily by caring more for the staff, encouraging better behavior, encouraging CARING in general, and fixing that menu. How do you screw up pizza? This is Buffalo, all we know how to do right is eat pizza and wings and drink delicious beer. So just know that we want to love it, and want to support it, but we never ever would have stayed if one of our party members is physically unable to travel long distances, hence why eating at the hotel made the most sense. Also, this is the 2nd time we've come here, and 2nd time we've been burned. Hard.
Great beet and friendly service
Beers are great, servers are excellent, but the food is really, REALLY lacking. It's...meh
Kielbasa with pierogis was awesome,  but should be renamed " forever flatulence then pee out your butt" Thanks!
Very cool place, great cocktails and friendly staff

No Sabres game is complete without a meal at the Pearl. The building is circa 1840. It still has the exquisite single drive belt driven fans throughout the main floor dining area. A live band is usually playing in some corner. There is a wide variety of food, and it's all really good. Of course the beer selection is impressive....

The only beers you'll find here are made in house, at a sister brewpub, or Labatt Blue/Blue Light. Wine list looks decent and the liquor selection is solid. The range of styles for staple beers is pretty good, helping make it easier for groups to find something each person enjoys. Weekly food specials are common and tend to be very good overall.

I called looking for a place for my daughters soccer team...about 30 of us all together...they were very accommodating and very quick with their response...we had a back room which was great for our group...service and food were excellent...prices were very reasonable...everyone enjoyed themselves
Wonderful atmosphere, great food, pleasant staff and beautiful decor. Great value
Food is great kind of on the expensive side great service brewery is good love there happy hour
Food was good, atmosphere was great, and service was excellent!
Great chicken and turkey sandwiches here, also have a great drink menu.
Amateur  bartenders

I first came here for my graduation dinner and enjoyed the atmosphere and the waiters. I now come for my paint nites and quiz night. My friends and I enjoy this place. Drinks are always done right. The people are friendly and the prices are reasonable for a downtown setting. It can get crowded if you come right after work (5pm) but there is a lot of space to sit as long as you don't want to hang out at the bar.

Very over priced for small portions of food that is not even that good. Went there in a group. Was told checks could not be split up. What sort of restaurant cannot split a bill? Especially when you know a large party is coming in?  Do not get the stuffed peppers. 9 dollars for two of the smallest peppers literally in a disgusting bath of marina sauce. More sauce than pepper.  Only positive was how pretty the place was.
I come here for lunch a few times a year. Brunch is good and so is the bison burger at lunchtime.  This restaurant has spiced up the once decrepit Hotel Lafayette. 1901 charm has came back.
Great beers and fireplace to enjoy some drinks.
Pulled Chicken Sandwich is always fantastic,  as are the beers brewed in house.  The Porter and Terminator are always good choices!
Great Food and beer

Clean, affordable and great beer brewed on the premises, the Pan-American Grill & Brewery is a great place to grab a bite and brew before the game (Sabres or Bisons)! Historic hotel, lots of hardwood with a classic feel.

I went here last night for my sisters graduation dinner party and I was very disappointed. The beer was over-priced and the food downright sucked. I ordered the spicy Asian wings extra crispy and they tasted like a**. They weren't crispy, in fact they were soggy. My sister and girlfriend got the roasted brisket sandwich. They informed me that the meat was dry and it was just doused with red stag bbq sauce which in return made it a very soggy hard sandwich to consume and enjoy. Needless to say this was our first and last time at the Pan American Grill.
